page.title: 01SLOUGH,DATCHET AND ETON
page.content: The area stretches from the riverside at Windsor across to Datchet and northwards to the southern part of central Slough,including Eton. A large proportion of the south is open space,including both the public and private parts of the Home Park adjoining Windsor Castle,the Brocas which are open fields by the river at Eton, and Agar's Plough which are playing fields for Eton College. The land is extremely flat and the noticeable exceptions are the castle in Windsor and the northern area which lies on the 1st terrace above the river Thames flood plain. There is a marked contrast between historic Eton and the modern Slough High Street,the quiet lanes and the M.4 motorway with aeroplanes leaving Heathrow Airport to the east.
